CollectionHelpers

Method Detail

filterMap

public static <T,U> void filterMap(java.util.Map<T,U> source,
                                   java.util.Map<T,U> dest,
                                   Predicate<U> filter)
Copies all entries from source that have the predicate filter to dest.

Type Parameters:
T - the key type of the maps.
U - the value type of the maps.
Parameters:
source - the source map. May not be null.
dest - the destination map. May not be null. If this map already contains entries, they might be overwritten by entries from source with the same key.
filter - a filter that determines the entries from source that are to be put into dest.

filter

public static <T> void filter(java.util.Collection<T> source,
                              java.util.Collection<T> dest,
                              Predicate<T> filter)
Copies all entries from source that have the predicate filter to dest in the order in which they are returned by source's iterator.

Type Parameters:
T - the entry type of the collections.
Parameters:
source - the source collection. May not be null.
dest - the destination collection. May not be null. If it already contains entries, the behaviour depends on the add implementation of the underlying collection. For example, a set prevents duplicate entries, but a list does not.
filter - a filter that determines the entries from source that are to be added to dest.

copyNSorted

public static <T> void copyNSorted(java.util.Collection<T> source,
                                   java.util.Collection<T> dest,
                                   java.util.Comparator<T> order,
                                   int n)
Sorts source and adds the first n entries to dest. If source contains less than n entries, all of them are added to dest. If adding an entry to dest does not increase the collection's size, for example if dest is a set and already contained the inserted contact, an additional entry of source will be added, if available. This guarantees that n new, distinct entries are added to collection dest as long as this can be fulfilled with the contents of source, and as dest does recognise duplicate entries. Consequently, this guarantee does not hold for simple lists. Both collections may not be null.

Type Parameters:
T - the entry type of the collections.
Parameters:
source - the source collection.
dest - the destination collection.
order - the order in which source is to be sorted.
n - the number of new entries that are to be added to dest.

copyNSortedAndFiltered

public static <T> void copyNSortedAndFiltered(java.util.Collection<T> source,
                                              java.util.Collection<T> dest,
                                              Predicate<T> filter,
                                              java.util.Comparator<T> order,
                                              int n)
Sorts source and adds the first n entries that match filter to dest. If source contains less than n entries, all of them are added to dest. For details, see copyNSorted(Collection, Collection, Comparator, int), except that source is filtered using filter before selecting entries to copy.

Type Parameters:
T - the entry type of the collections.
Parameters:
source - the source collection.
dest - the destination collection.
filter - a filter that filters netOut entries of source before sorting.
order - the order in which source is to be sorted.
n - the number of new entries that are to be added to dest.

copyUntilFull

public static <T,U> void copyUntilFull(java.util.Map<T,U> source,
                                       java.util.Map<T,U> dest1,
                                       java.util.Map<T,U> overflow,
                                       int dest1Capacity)
Copies the entries from source to dest1 until dest1 has reached size dest1Capacity. The remaining entries are saved in overflow. The order of insertion depends on the iterator of the underlying map. Note that as dest1 is a map, inserting an entry with a key that already exists in the map does not increase its size (if the insertion is permitted).

Type Parameters:
T - the key type.
U - the entry/value type.
Parameters:
source - the mappings to be copied.
dest1 - the first destination for the entries, to be filled until its size reaches dest1Capacity.
overflow - destination for the remaining entries.
dest1Capacity - maximum allowed size for dest1.

splitMap

public static <T,U> void splitMap(java.util.Map<T,U> source,
                                  java.util.Map<T,U> dest1,
                                  java.util.Map<T,U> dest2,
                                  Predicate<U> firstPredicate)
Distributes the contents of source into dest1 and dest2 according to the predicate firstPredicate. All entries that match firstPredicate are inserted into dest1, the remaining entries are inserted into dest2.

Parameters:
source - the map with the entries that are to be distributed over dest1 and dest2.
dest1 - a Map that will receive all entries from source which match firstPredicate.
dest2 - a Map that will receive all entries from source that do not match firstPredicate.
firstPredicate - a predicate that indicates those entries that are to be saved into dest1. All remaining entries, that is those that do not match firstPredicate, are saved into dest2. Uses the entry to compare, not the key.
